lines.text: Are you Nancy Evans?
Yes.
You seem kinda young to be boss of a circus.
I'll soon get over that.
She's thinking of growing a beard to give her dignity.
Well, this is just great. We wreck the circus to make her sell the ranch and now she's going to live on it.
No she's not.
Well, what are you going to do?
We'll be in Mesquite ahead of the young lady with a reception committee.
Well, we're nearly home, boys.
The 3-M will look mighty good after that set-to in Santa Fe.
Don't forget, we've been away for three months. Most likely, we'll have to dig it out from under the dust.
That is, if the moths have left us anything to dig out.
[after Hercules played a card, Willie the Gorilla grabbed it and put it back in Hercules' hand]
Hey! What are you doin' gangin' up on me? One baboon at a time!
Can't a guy change his mind, Lil?
Yeah, providin' he's got a mind to start with. Besides I ain't playin' cards with a man who has a moth-eaten monkey for partner.
[to the gorilla climbing in a tree]
Get out of there, you upholstered nitwit!
Hey, gang, take a look at your new home!
Ain't it somethin'!
Yeah, so quiet and peaceful. I wonder how long it takes to learn how to milk a chicken.
C'mon, let's invite the ladies to scram.
Let me do it. I'll, you know, sort of break it to her gently.
Tactful Tucson, they call him - the big-hearted bouncer.
What's your job around here?
I'm a cowhand, ma'am. I chase cows.
If I could only learn to moo.
[intent on a showdown with Mike Abbott, the Mesquiteers discover that he's not in his hotel room]
Maybe we should go in and sort of tidy up the room.
Funny, that's just what I was thinkin'.
[Hercules waives an enormous gun at the Mesquiteers]
Don't pull the trigger - you'll wind up in South Dakota!
Give us a break, Desperate Desmond.
Be careful, guys. Don't over eat.
I had more trouble catchin' those sardines than I've had ropin' a calf.
I wish you had roped a calf!
We gotta figure out some way to help Nancy.
If I was Nancy, I'd be just a little bit tired of our help.
Well, we can't let her lose her ranch.
What about ours? If we can't pay our own mortgage, we won't have any place to sleep.
Oh, yes we will. We'll have a nice cozy cell to sleep in for the next twenty years, if Mr. Brooke keeps bein' helpful.
[last lines]
Well, that Nancy sure is a swell girl. I reckon we oughta take in her circus sometime.
Tucson, I think you've got something there.
[Lullaby bursts out of the ranch house pursued by Nancy's gorilla]
Nancy! Nancy! You forgot somethin'!
What happened to you? Did you fall into a watering trough?
No, I just fell into a Saturday night!
